Creating maps using spatial data in R

GIS is an area of R coding I have kept away from hoping that I would work it out at a later date.

Sadly, it has got to the point where I want to be able to build more complex maps in shiny applications towards the end of my PhD and need to create a base of code to go from. Luckily, the text book "Spatial Analysis in R" has just come out in its second edition and is available in as a bookdown repository including the full text

KMZ files are just...

...zipped KML files

Posted on March 7, 2019

A KMZ file is just a zipped KML file, possibly with associated embedded images, icons, etc. So any program that supports KMZ files internally unzips them to access their KML files. That may be a reason why many open source programs do not bother supporting KMZ once KML support is... [Read More]
